author: Dominik Tilman
title: Tutorial for Community Advisors
description: The rapid growth in Catalyst increases the need for good Community Advisors, otherwise poor assessments will affect the quality of Catalyst

assessments.note: This could be a useful tool in educating new CA's. Given the load already on CA's, would they spend additional time on? Would this be a required module before being able to asses for new CA's?

The basis of all decision making is to be well informed. Having good video tutorials will lower the entry barrier for new CAs and this will lead to a better general understanding of the role within the CA-community.

The problem and solution statement is reasonable and objective. The creation of tutorials for CAs is within the scope of the challenge and has a great potential for impact on decision making. The proposal has a plan for these tutorials to remain updated during the next Funds, which is an essential point to guarantee the relevance and impact of the tutorials during the next Funds.

As a new CA, I can say that this proposal corresponds directly to my immediate need and it is a need for the development of the Catalyst program to improve the quality of reviews. To guide me, I have for the moment only the CA Onboarding guide. I lack experience in evaluating a roadmap or the depth of development of an idea. The proposal will help increase the number of CAs and especially the quality of their reviews by providing them with the keys to reading and evaluating projects.

It is a proven fact that a large percentage of the population is able to learn new information through video much more efficiently. Having a much more informed pool of community advisors would greatly improve the decision making process of Project Catalyst as a whole. This would lead to a better outcome for the whole Cardano community.

You have directly addressed the issue of Community Advisor training as stated as a potential direction on the F5 Distributed Decision Making cover page. You have designed a good range of potential content in your tutorials and have outlined how the proposal will continue to be a community project into the future. I would consider that the information presented might also be useful for proposers themselves. Thanks for your efforts.

Reading the proposal, I think that you should include the proposers in these videos scope. Looking to the suggestions of video's content, it is very clear that not only the CA would benefit from them, but actually it seems that maybe the proposer would benefit even more. 
One thing that kept my attention is that you helped to create the CA guideline, which is a written 'FAQ' and that gave you several insights and feedback which helped you to think about this proposal. However, have you received lots of messages suggesting that a video series would benefit the community? I am saying this because it seems to me that ask 10% of the challenge funds to change the format of an information is a lot. It would be of a great value if you share some of the feedbacks and the requests – would clarify how many more people would be reached compared with the written format.
assessments.reply: As I have clearly expressed in the proposal, the video content will be "screen-sharing content", so it is more like a webinar and not a classic video, where video skills like cutting/editing are required.

assessments.note:
This proposal id's a current problem. The exponential growth in number of proposals adds a strain on CA's, most of them which are also new to the system. The proposal would benefit of some real figures e.g. current proposals per registered CA, number of flagged assessment in previous rounds.
Well written and updated guidelines already solve this problem but having video complements would certainly help and likely prove a better medium for some people, and have a positive impact on the progress of Catalyst.

This proposal will have a greater impact in ensuring that CA are given proper resources in a central location to learn and build their skills to enable future assessment reviews for each funding step.  There is a plan to help improve and make updates as needed for the future.
The proposer showed his skills already on other projects for catalyst (ca guidelines) and the references are also convincing.

The proposer is an active member of the Catalyst community and helped coordinate the CA assessment guide for Fund5. There are details about the proposer's experience and qualification, as well as links to his website, where it is possible to have more information and access to his Linkedin, this information allows the community to transparently check the proposer's capacity.

There is a reasonable and detailed plan for creating the tutorials. The tutorials were well structured and will be organized in modules so that they can be updated in a practical way as the documentation and the assessment process is updated. The topics cited for the tutorials are relevant and reasonable.

There is a well-established roadmap that provides for the delivery of tutorials in 3 months, which indicates a potential impact in the short term, which is an important point to meet the challenge.

The proposed budget seems consistent with the ambition of the initial development. A budget is foreseen for future updates to cover the evolutions of the evaluation process of proposals in future Funds. However, there is a risk of having to recreate a significant part of the video content if the process of evaluation of the proposals, which is still young, evolves.

The only thing more I would have wished from this proposal would have been a short sample video of the intended outcome. The proposal seems very qualified in marketing and it's clear by his proposal that he's a proficient writer, but no reference to his background in video production is given. The proposal is for a video series after all.
assessments.reply: As I have clearly expressed in the proposal, the video content will be "screen-sharing content", so it is not a video, where video skills are required.

assessments.note: I am satisfied that you will be able to  complete the task that you have set yourself. It is reassuring that you are already involved in working with the Community Advisor Guidelines and that you have created the website that hosts information currently. Your budget seems to be an entirely reasonable amount which will allow you to create more content and I like the fact that you have budgeted incentives for further contributors.

It is clear that the proposer has the knowledge to create the content and I imagine that part of the budget asked in the 'creating video' section would be directed to some professionals on the described field (editing, scripting, etc). I the project would benefit from a more detailed budget.
It seems to me that the themes proposed are very general, it would be helpful to any challenge, thus I assume that they will be like a foundation of the series. Therefore I imagine that the updates of the actual funds, challenge and criteria will be launched after. If this is true, I am a bit lost in this roadmap – 1 month to create one video and 2 to create 9 – would be of great interest to have more detail.

The proposer seems to have the experience to implement this proposal. Ideally, we could see some previous video work the proposer has done, but given that the proposer has mentioned that he will rely on community feedback i'm confident good content will be produced. There is an overall emphasis on community participation, which is a strong point of this proposal. The content and structure of the tutorials are clear and well layed out and the timelines presented are realistic. The requested budget is sensible.

The proposer has reasonable experience in the communications side to enable a tutorial program for CAs.  There is a sole proposer who may cause some risk in development if other priorities or unforeseen events were to happen.  For the scope and size of the project, the budget seems a reasonable amount. and a plan and roadmap are available for the development of the tutorial.  The KPI metrics are largely driven by subsequent actions from the project being concluded and maybe additional development metrics would be nice to have included as well.  The proposer has already helped to develop CA documentation in the past and is committed to the cause.
The proposal is feasible. One question I do have is the additional time load this may put on community members. Will this discourage their use? How long are the tutorials going to be?
assessments.reply: "The proposal is feasable" but only a score of 3? Why should the involvment of the community "discourage" the use of the proposal? This Feedback is not constructive here.

assessments.note: KPI/Metric and Roadmap is stated and make sense. All of the are SMART (specific, measureable, activating, realistic, time-bound.)

There is clarity in describing the problem and the solution. The proposal is in line with the challenge.

Various information has been described so that the proposal can be audited. There is a clear, objective roadmap with milestones. There are relevant KPIS. There are details about the proposer and his qualification / experience.

The budget was divided into 4 parts and there is information on how much will be allocated to each part, however, as there is no estimate of how many hours the tutorials will have in total, it is difficult to assess the feasibility of the budget. The budget amount was not defined by hourly load and it would be important to understand what the cost related to the result would be.

With the increase in the number of CAs over the funds, one might think that the quality of the evaluations would decrease under the effect of the inclusion of a less specialized audience. Reducing reported reviews and reviews denied by senior CAs is an effective measure of the impact of this project, making its effectiveness clearly measurable.

Trying to improve the effectiveness and engagement of CAs in the future through video content is a great idea. The proposal details almost every aspect about his planned implementation, however I would have liked to see a clearer vision for the structure of the videos themselves, apart from the fact that they'll be modular. Still, much better than other proposals that focus on the production of video content.

I think it would be of a great help to add some sort of a communication channel which would allow anyone to really see if the script is being completed, or the videos are being edited or recorded, etc – not have to wait until the video is complete would be great.
A realistic timeline is proposed as well as tangible KPI's which will allow the community to understand what impact the videos are having on the review process of ProjectCatalyst

There is a roadmap with some project deliverables included as well as a plan for future changes/scalability included in this proposal.  Some challenges may be in delivering items on time given the sole proposer planning to do the work themselves.    Due to this a clearer milestone or feature delivery schedule would help make it more clear to determine if the project is moving at the right pace.
The Roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit.

solution: A Tutorial to onboard and teach new/existing Community Advisors to ensure high-quality assessments which help voters to make good decisions
experience:
10+ years in Marketing

University Degree (M.Sc.) in Marketing & Communication

4+ years entrepreneur and business consultant
